thread.title: Dodgers Season Ends in Heartbreaking Fashion
thread.title_full: Dodgers Season Ends in Heartbreaking Fashion

author: MICHAEL DUARTE
title: Dodgers Season Ends in Heartbreaking Fashion
text: Contact Us Dodgers Drop Heartbreaker 3-2 in Game 5 of NLDS, Mets Advance The Los Angeles Dodgers dropped a heartbreaker in Game 5 of the National League Division Series 3-2 on Thursday Night as the New York Mets advanced to the NLCS. Privacy Policy | More Newsletters Getty Images : Zack Greinke #21 of the Los Angeles Dodgers reacts as Daniel Murphy #28 of the New York Mets rounds the bases after he hits a solo home run in the sixth inning in game five of the National League Division Series at Dodger Stadium on October 15, 2015 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Harry How/Getty Images) One hundred and sixty-seven games and it call came down to a costly mistake. The Los Angeles Dodgers dropped a heartbreaker in Game 5 of the National League Division Series 3-2 on Thursday Night as the New York Mets advanced to the NLCS for the first time since 2006. Human Trafficking Crackdown Nets 8 Arrests in Bay Area Daniel Murphy did all the damage for the Mets, knocking in two runs and scoring the game-tying run on the most bizarre of plays: With the Dodgers leading 2-1 and Murphy on first base, Zack Greinke issued a walk to Mets slugger Lucas Duda. Murphy casually walked to first, but smartly saw LA's infield was in a shift and nobody was covering third base. Murphy touched the bag at second and took off for third stealing the base easily. â€” ESPN Stats & Info (@ESPNStatsInfo) October 16, 2015 One batter latter, Murphy would score on a sacrifice fly to right field, tying the winner-take-all game at 2-2. Video Porn Audio Plays Over Target PA System Two innings later, he would hit the go-ahead home run that would send the Mets to the NLCS against the Chicago Cubs. After two consecutive postseasons saw the Dodgers eliminated with Clayton Kershaw on the mound, Greinke was finally given the chance to extend the Dodgers season in a winner-take-all single elimination game. Nevada Shuts Down Daily Fantasy Sports Sites Greinke struggled in the first inning, surrendering an RBI double to Murphy to give the Mets an early 1-0 lead. The Dodgers struck back in the bottom half of the inning off 2014 NL Rookie of the Year, Jacob DeGrom. DeGrom was unhittable in Game 1 of the series, but allowed four singles in the first, and LA came roaring back to take the lead. Two Bay Area Cities Named Best for Trick-or-Treating Dodgers outfielder Andre Ethier made a diving catch in the second inning to save a run for Los Angeles, but was seen arguing with manager Don Mattingly in the bottom half of the third inning, for not advancing Justin Turner who led off the inning with a double. The Dodgers would not score another run after the first inning, and the Mets would celebrate thanks to Murphy's heroics. Murphy's solo home run in the sixth inning joins him with Darry Stawberry and Ray Knight as the only Mets to homer in a winner-take-all game.
